column4: I am trying to install Zend Studio on Edgy, but I keep getting errors because it can't find libm.so.6, libc.so.6, librt.so.1, and a few others...
is that a binary app on amd64? (just guessng)
I'm not sure, I don't use any special 64-bit software... I'm 32-bit all the way...
then nevermind , sure does osund weird in that case, sooy, no help here
run 'ldd' on that binary, see what it looks for maybe
how do I run ldd on it?  (I've never used ldd before)
ldd ZendStudio-5_2_0.bin simply states "not a dynamic executable"
ldd `which whateveryoucallittostartit`
that is an installer, have you installed it?
it is the installer, but I can't install it because of the errors, but I found a knowledge base entry at zend... thanks!
ln -sf /bin/bash /bin/sh
sh is dash and my matrox installer failed with all sorts of funky fresh errors too, we need bash for those
so did that fix your issue?
I found out the problem was caused because of an incompatibility of the installer's JRE with "certain system libraries"
simply commenting out a couple of lines in the installer fixed the issue
I'm not sure if this would help you with other apps, but here is the link: http://www.zend.com/support/knowledgebase.php?kbid=184&view_only=1
cool too, but that /bin/sh is link to dash will bite you down the road, uness you did switch it to bash
I'm not quite sure how to switch it to bash (still a newbie in areas)
i showed you a line with ln -sf in it, that should have done it ;)
mcrandello: I did that, but I still get the same errors when trying to launch the installer
the installer worked after I commented out the lines, but now I can't launch the application itself
